Title: Scottish Neighbourhood Statistics
DataContent: Scottish Neighbourhood Statistics is the Scottish Governments route to disseminate the range of small area statistics including information on health, education, poverty, unemployment, housing, population, crime and social / community issues at the data zone level and above which support a number of the Governments targets and commitments aimed at closing the gap between disadvantaged areas and the rest of Scotland.

Title: iSD Scotland
DataContent: Scotland has some of the best health service data in the world. Few other countries have information which combines high quality data, consistency, national coverage and the ability to link data to allow patient based analysis and follow up. Information Services Division (ISD) is Scotland's national organisation for health information, statistics and IT services.

Title: ScotlandsPeople
DataContent: The official government source of genealogical data for Scotland
DataSourceDepartment: General Register Office for Scotland, the National Archives of Scotland, Court of the Lord Lyon

Title: General Register Office for Scotland statistics
DataContent: The General Register Office for Scotland (GROS) publishes statistics at a number of different geography levels. Although some statistics are only available at Scotland level, many are available at sub-Scotland geographies (for example, council area or NHS Board).
DataSourceDepartment: The General Register Office for Scotland (GROS)

Title: Baseline Scotland: groundwater chemistry data
DataContent: Baseline Scotland: data on groundwater chemistry in Scotland to provide a scientific foundation to Scottish, UK and European water quality policy.
DataSourceDepartment: British Geological Survey and Scottish Environment Protection Agency

Title: The Centre for the Study of Retailing in Scotland data sets
DataContent: The Centre for the Study of Retailing in Scotland (CSRS) aims to enhance the knowledge and understanding of the retail sector in Scotland.
DataSourceDepartment: Centre for the Study of Retailing in Scotland

Title: Growing Up in Scotland
DataContent: The Growing Up in Scotland study is a a large-scale longitudinal social survey which follows the lives of groups of Scotland's children from infancy through to their teens.

Ministerial Hospitality

Title: Scottish Government Disclosure of High Earners
DataContent:
Disclosure of High Earners
The Scottish Government now publishes a list of names, job titles and salaries of high earners (those earning £150,000 or more per year) in Scottish NDPBs and Public Corporations.

Title: Scotlands Places
DataContent:
You can now find information about Scottish places past and present, selected from the holdings of the partner organisations. This includes digital copies of:

Maps and plans of cities, towns, villages, farms, roads, canals, harbours, churches, schools, public buildings, private houses, mines and quarries 
Photographs of the built environment in The Royal Commission on the Ancient and Historical Monuments of Scotland 
Archaeological reports on historic and prehistoric sites 
Manuscript records and printed books from millions of pages in government and private records, including tax rolls, owners of land and heritages, and the annual reports of county Medical Officers of Health

Title: Scottish National Heritage Facts
DataContent: Various SNH facts and figures

Title: Scottish Natural Spaces
DataContent:
Natural Spaces provides an online data download facility giving access to a wide range of datasets including protected areas, habitats and species, landscape, open space and access. A simple one-off registration gives you instant access to data and provides you with a personal bookshelf showing all datasets downloaded along with details of any updates since your last visit. 

Data is available as ESRI Shapefiles or the OGC standard formats GML and KML.

Title: Scotland National Address Gazetteer
DataContent: National Address Gazetteer

Title: Scottish Environment Protection Agency
DataContent:
A key role for SEPA is to monitor and report on the state of Scotland’s environment. We publish a wide range of environmental information and advise Ministers, partner bodies, regulated industry and the public on environmental issues.

The navigation on the left highlights our corporate publications. Throughout the website you can find specialist brochures, publications and reports
